SENT.plain: A patient with BehÃ§et's syndrome suffered acute paraparesis during sigmoidoscopy
An aortogram demonstrated thrombosis of the distal abdominal aorta just above the bifurcation; thrombectomy resulted in complete return of neurologic function
Examination of the clot disclosed a preponderance of polymorphonuclear granulocytes
We propose that mechanical trauma from this otherwise benign procedure caused the vascular lesion
Patients with a similar predisposition to arterial or venous thrombosis may, in unusual circumstances, be jeopardized by proctosigmoidoscopy
